1.name: Al-Fatihah
1.overview: Known as the Opening, this surah is a prayer for guidance, lordship, and mercy.

2.name: Al-Baqarah
2.overview: The longest surah in the Qur'an, covering law, faith, guidance, and stories of prophets.

3.name: Al-Imran
3.overview: Focuses on the family of Imran, steadfastness, and lessons from battles.

4.name: An-Nisa
4.overview: Addresses family law, inheritance, and justice in social relations.

5.name: Al-Maidah
5.overview: Deals with dietary laws, covenants, and the story of Jesus and the disciples.

6.name: Al-Anam
6.overview: Emphasizes monotheism and arguments against polytheism.

7.name: Al-Araf
7.overview: Narrates stories of prophets and the people of the Heights on Judgment Day.

8.name: Al-Anfal
8.overview: Revealed after the Battle of Badr, covers war rules and distribution of spoils.

9.name: At-Tawbah
9.overview: Known as the Declaration of Immunity, discusses treaties and hypocrites.

10.name: Yunus
10.overview: Named after Prophet Jonah, emphasizing divine mercy and signs of God.

11.name: Hud
11.overview: Contains narratives of earlier prophets, stressing patience and reliance on Allah.

12.name: Yusuf
12.overview: Tells the complete story of Prophet Joseph, a lesson in patience and destiny.

13.name: Ar-Rad
13.overview: Stresses Allah's power in nature and people's responses to revelation.

14.name: Ibrahim
14.overview: Highlights the message of Prophet Abraham and gratitude to Allah.

15.name: Al-Hijr
15.overview: Warns of past nations' destruction and reassures the Prophet of protection.

16.name: An-Nahl
16.overview: Called the Bee, discusses blessings of Allah and gratitude.

17.name: Al-Isra
17.overview: Also called Bani Isra'il; covers moral teachings and the Night Journey.

18.name: Al-Kahf
18.overview: Famous for the story of the People of the Cave, lessons on faith and trials.

19.name: Maryam
19.overview: Narrates the story of Mary and miraculous births of prophets.

20.name: Taha
20.overview: Centers on the story of Moses and Allah's guidance.

21.name: Al-Anbiya
21.overview: The Prophets; recounts missions of various prophets and Judgment Day.

23.name: Al-Muminun
23.overview: Characteristics of true believers and stories of earlier prophets.

24.name: An-Nur
24.overview: Regulates social conduct, modesty, and punishment for slander.

25.name: Al-Furqan
25.overview: Affirms the Qur’an as criterion of truth and falsehood.

26.name: Ash-Shuara
26.overview: Covers prophets' struggles and concludes with the role of poets.

27.name: An-Naml
27.overview: Includes stories of Solomon, Sheba, and signs of Allah.

28.name: Al-Qasas
28.overview: Narrates life of Moses from birth to mission.

29.name: Al-Ankabut
29.overview: The Spider; trials of faith and examples from history.

30.name: Ar-Rum
30.overview: Prophecy of Romans' victory, signs of Allah in creation.

31.name: Luqman
31.overview: Advice of Luqman to his son; wisdom and gratitude.

32.name: As-Sajda
32.overview: Emphasizes revelation, resurrection, and prostration to Allah.

33.name: Al-Ahzab
33.overview: Discusses Battle of the Confederates, family laws, and role of Prophet.

34.name: Saba
34.overview: Talks about people of Sheba and blessings of Allah.

35.name: Fatir
35.overview: The Originator; stresses angels, creation, and gratitude.

36.name: Ya-Sin
36.overview: Known as the heart of the Qur’an; covers resurrection and parables.

37.name: As-Saffat
37.overview: Talks of angels, prophets, and fate of believers and disbelievers.

38.name: Sad
38.overview: Narrates stories of David, Solomon, and others; affirms patience.

39.name: Az-Zumar
39.overview: Highlights sincerity in worship and scenes of the Hereafter.

40.name: Ghafir
40.overview: The Forgiver; discusses Pharaoh, Moses, and Allah’s forgiveness.

41.name: Fussilat
41.overview: Also called Ha Mim Sajda; speaks of Qur’an’s clarity and fate of nations.

42.name: Ash-Shura
42.overview: Encourages consultation, faith, and Allah’s sovereignty.

43.name: Az-Zukhruf
43.overview: The Gold Adornments; criticizes false worship and materialism.

44.name: Ad-Dukhan
44.overview: The Smoke; covers warnings and Pharaoh’s fate.

45.name: Al-Jathiya
45.overview: The Kneeling; speaks of signs of Allah and Judgment Day.

46.name: Al-Ahqaf
46.overview: Talks about the people of the Dunes and story of jinn listening to Qur’an.

47.name: Muhammad
47.overview: Also called Surah Qital; deals with warfare and qualities of believers.

48.name: Al-Fath
48.overview: The Victory; references Treaty of Hudaybiyyah.

49.name: Al-Hujurat
49.overview: Emphasizes etiquette, brotherhood, and avoiding suspicion.

50.name: Qaf
50.overview: Deals with resurrection, judgment, and reflection on creation.

51.name: Adh-Dhariyat
51.overview: The Winnowing Winds; speaks of creation, warnings, and stories of prophets.

52.name: At-Tur
52.overview: The Mount; emphasizes the truth of resurrection and fate of disbelievers.

53.name: An-Najm
53.overview: The Star; affirms revelation and condemns idolatry.

54.name: Al-Qamar
54.overview: The Moon; narrates past peoples’ denial and their destruction.

55.name: Ar-Rahman
55.overview: The Most Merciful; enumerates Allah’s blessings and contrasts paradise and hell.

56.name: Al-Waqia
56.overview: The Inevitable; describes scenes of the afterlife and three groups of people.

57.name: Al-Hadid
57.overview: The Iron; speaks of charity, faith, and worldly detachment.

58.name: Al-Mujadila
58.overview: The Woman Who Disputes; addresses social issues and secret councils.

59.name: Al-Hashr
59.overview: The Gathering; refers to Banu Nadir’s exile and Allah’s beautiful names.

60.name: Al-Mumtahina
60.overview: The Woman to be Examined; on loyalty and dealing with disbelievers.

61.name: As-Saff
61.overview: The Ranks; encourages unity, sincerity, and struggle in Allah’s cause.

62.name: Al-Jumua
62.overview: The Friday; highlights the importance of Friday prayer and obedience.

63.name: Al-Munafiqun
63.overview: The Hypocrites; exposes characteristics of hypocrisy.

64.name: At-Taghabun
64.overview: Mutual Disillusion; emphasizes belief in Allah, patience, and gratitude.

65.name: At-Talaq
65.overview: The Divorce; gives regulations for divorce and trust in Allah.

66.name: At-Tahrim
66.overview: The Prohibition; addresses issues of the Prophet’s household and repentance.

67.name: Al-Mulk
67.overview: The Sovereignty; highlights Allah’s creation, power, and the Hereafter.

68.name: Al-Qalam
68.overview: The Pen; defends the Prophet’s character and narrates parable of the owners of the garden.

69.name: Al-Haaqqa
69.overview: The Inevitable; depicts past destructions and scenes of resurrection.

70.name: Al-Maarij
70.overview: The Ascending Stairways; describes human impatience and scenes of Judgment Day.

71.name: Nuh
71.overview: Narrates Prophet Noah’s call to his people and their rejection.

72.name: Al-Jinn
72.overview: Tells of the jinn hearing the Qur’an and their reactions.

73.name: Al-Muzzammil
73.overview: The Enshrouded One; encourages night prayer and patience.

74.name: Al-Muddathir
74.overview: The Cloaked One; calls for warning and patience.

75.name: Al-Qiyama
75.overview: The Resurrection; vivid description of Judgment Day.

76.name: Al-Insan
76.overview: The Human; emphasizes charity, patience, and paradise.

77.name: Al-Mursalat
77.overview: The Emissaries; warns of Judgment Day and fate of disbelievers.

78.name: An-Naba
78.overview: The Tidings; describes resurrection, creation, and hell vs paradise.

79.name: An-Naziat
79.overview: The Soul-Snatchers; covers resurrection and story of Pharaoh and Moses.

80.name: Abasa
80.overview: He Frowned; emphasizes Qur’an’s guidance and accountability.

81.name: At-Takwir
81.overview: The Overthrowing; portrays cosmic signs of the Last Day.

82.name: Al-Infitar
82.overview: The Cleaving; describes scenes of the Hereafter.

83.name: Al-Mutaffifin
83.overview: The Defrauders; warns against cheating in trade and contrasts paradise vs hell.

84.name: Al-Inshiqaq
84.overview: The Splitting Open; speaks of resurrection and accountability.

85.name: Al-Buruj
85.overview: The Mansions of the Stars; warns oppressors and praises the steadfast.

86.name: At-Tariq
86.overview: The Morning Star; asserts Allah’s power over life and death.

87.name: Al-Ala
87.overview: The Most High; praises Allah and contrasts this life with the Hereafter.

88.name: Al-Ghashiya
88.overview: The Overwhelming; describes faces of the Hereafter, hell and paradise.

89.name: Al-Fajr
89.overview: The Dawn; warns arrogant nations and depicts the soul at peace.

90.name: Al-Balad
90.overview: The City; emphasizes struggle and virtue.

91.name: Ash-Shams
91.overview: The Sun; contrasts purified vs corrupted souls.

92.name: Al-Lail
92.overview: The Night; speaks of charity, greed, and ultimate destiny.

93.name: Ad-Duha
93.overview: The Morning Brightness; reassures the Prophet of Allah’s care.

94.name: Ash-Sharh
94.overview: The Relief; reminds of ease after hardship.

95.name: At-Tin
95.overview: The Fig; affirms human dignity and accountability.

96.name: Al-Alaq
96.overview: The Clot; first revelation, emphasizes reading and knowledge.

97.name: Al-Qadr
97.overview: The Night of Power; highlights the blessed night when Qur’an was revealed.

98.name: Al-Bayyina
98.overview: The Clear Proof; stresses purity of faith and distinction between believers and disbelievers.

99.name: Az-Zalzala
99.overview: The Earthquake; describes the earth shaking on Judgment Day.

100.name: Al-Adiyat
100.overview: The Chargers; vivid imagery of horses and human ingratitude.

101.name: Al-Qaria
101.overview: The Striking Calamity; depicts the Day of Judgment.

102.name: At-Takathur
102.overview: The Rivalry; condemns greed and distraction.

103.name: Al-Asr
103.overview: The Time; stresses patience, truth, and mutual advice.

104.name: Al-Humaza
104.overview: The Slanderer; condemns greed and gossip.

105.name: Al-Fil
105.overview: The Elephant; recalls Allah’s protection of the Kaaba.

106.name: Quraish
106.overview: Urges Quraysh to worship Allah who secured them and fed them.

107.name: Al-Maun
107.overview: The Small Kindnesses; condemns hypocrisy and neglect of orphans.

108.name: Al-Kawthar
108.overview: The Abundance; promises abundant blessings to the Prophet.

109.name: Al-Kafiroon
109.overview: The Disbelievers; stresses distinction between belief and disbelief.

110.name: An-Nasr
110.overview: The Divine Support; foretells the Prophet’s victory and people entering Islam in droves.

111.name: Al-Masad
111.overview: The Palm Fiber; condemns Abu Lahab and his wife.

113.name: Al-Falaq
113.overview: The Daybreak; seeks refuge from external evils.

114.name: An-Nas
114.overview: The Mankind; seeks refuge from internal and external whispers of evil.
